questions.question: RICK So what's the missions that are in the horizon that you could talk to?
So what does teaming, what does AI and humans working together in space look like?
Do we really understand, in this case, human and machine interactions, the human decision process alongside the machine processes?
How do you make a plane disappear so it looks as big as a ball bearing?
So if you miss the first or the second one, you catch the next one, right?
Do I think that we're going to see a day anytime soon when there are no humans in the cockpit?
But is there any exploration of perception of, for example, detecting a G-lock that the pilot is out?
Do you have a sense of why human civilization has not destroyed itself through nuclear war?
Is it being ready to attack or is it the defensive systems that catch attacks?
What are your thoughts on the efforts of the new folks, SpaceX and Elon Musk?
What innovations, obviously you can't predict the future, but do you see Lockheed in the next hundred years?
If you take that same leap, how will the world of technology and engineering change?
